Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, I have updated the roster with our new crew members. We have taken on three mechanics, two medical staff, five--
Thank you, Archimede, I can read the rest.
You know I'm not happy with this.

Fields.MenuText: I do, and I understand. It's unfortunate, but we will make do.
Yes, you are very selective with your crew.
I didn't know, but I should have guessed.

Fields.DialogueText: A single weak link breaks the chain.
I'm not selective. I am thorough in my selection.
I'm surprised you're not upset. No warning, no screening, not a problem?
Archimede, Command has several reviews and securities in place when assigning crews.
With all due respect, Command is focusing on the big picture. People slip through those big cracks.
Then I can trust you to be extra vigilant during your performance reviews?
Prepare for a mountain of paperwork.
*ALARM*
Let's see how they do.
@BATTLE
How are the new crew members performing?
Surprisingly well. They're learning the ropes, and there hasn't been a lot of conflict with the original crew.
I'm still missing some referrals, though.

Fields.MenuText: You see? Everything is working out.
Even we get lucky from time to time.
Maybe you should have a little more faith in Command?

Fields.DialogueText: I wouldn't go that far, but the situation is looking up.
I don't believe in luck, Capitano. I will admit Command did a better job than I thought.
Maybe I should. Nonetheless, I won't let up just yet.
Moving on, do you have any theories about our mission?
If ships are disappearing in Sector 593, the most likely explanation is Morgana attacks.
But how do you explain no evidence of battles? No Morgana ships in the vicinity?
It's a mystery, Capitano. That's why they are sending you.
*ALARM*
I'm flattered, but I think Command has more faith you will solve this problem.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Capitano, Cattive Ragazze approaching from the south.
Bring us around.
@BATTLE
Well done, Archimede.
Grazie. Do you know any ghost stories?

Fields.MenuText: I know a few. Why do you ask?
Do I? I don't think anyone here could tell me one I haven't heard. Why?
No. You're not going to tell me one, are you?

Fields.DialogueText: I have read all of the horror stories on board, but most of the crew know them already.
I've been looking for a good one, and there are slim pickings here.
I wasn't going to, no. Are you afraid of ghost stories, Capitano?
Why the sudden interest?
The crew are telling each other scary stories. Everyone is trying to out-scare each other.
And you want in on it.
It's important to know the crew and that they know me. I've found mingling is far more effective than formal meetings.
And it has nothing to do with that competitive side of yours?
I never said that. Of course I'm competing. It's a competition.
Just take it easy on them. I don't need a crew that's jumping at their own shadow.
Yes, Capitano!
BrRrRrRrR! bRrRrRrR! Archimede!
*ALARM*
Archimede! BrRrRrR! I'm playing the kazoo! We have incoming! BrRrRrR!
This is the Capitano, all stations report in! Someone reply, that's an order!
CaPtain? Ha! It faNcieS itsElf a CAPTAIN!?

Fields.MenuText: Crewmember, if this is a prank, it ends now!
Who is this?
FALL IN crewmember! Report.

Fields.DialogueText: A PraNk, yEs yes. ShhHhh...
WhO is tHis. wHo iS thIs. Who Is thiS.
iT thiNks iT's tAlkinG tO somEoNe? HaHAhajAJaja!
@BATTLE
Capitano? You were talking in your sleep.
Archimede? Thank you... What a nightmare.
Want to talk about it?
No, it wasn't very interesting.
I'll give you your privacy then. Get some rest, Capitano.
Then I will throw a lightning bolt at the Cyclops.
You can't do that, Capitano.
Why not? I thought I was Zeus?
You are, but you already threw three lightning bolts. You need to rest before you can throw them again.
Then I will teleport away.
You already had your teleport turn.

Fields.MenuText: Archimede, I like this game, but I need the rules written down. There are too many rules.
This game of yours is far too confusing.
When we started this game, you said it was about imagination. Why is my imagination against the rules?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Capitano, I've been working on a rulebook. I've just had a little writer's block.
I know it is. I'm sorry. I've been trying to write down all of the rules.
If it was only imagination, Capitano, you would just imagine you won and we'd be done.
What are you calling this again?
Adventures of Mathematics and Imagination.
*ALARM*
You might need to rework the title. Let's go.
Yes, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Capitano, the Cattive Ragazze are here.
Where? I don't see anything. Sound the alarm, I trust you.
I hear them.

Fields.MenuText: Hear them? You're speaking with them?
That means they are close right? Where are they?
Archimede, sound the alarm. Now!

Fields.DialogueText: I don't speak with them CaPtaIn. I LisTen.
We don't know where wE aRe, dO we?
The alarm? ToO loUd, iSn't iT faR toO loUd!?
Dreaming... I just need to ride this out. Just a dream.
I hAd a DreAm oNce, CaPiTanO.
wE weRe aLl DroWniNg!
@BATTLE
Bah! What is this? Sweat soaked sheets? Better than the alternative.
Capitano, I have had it! I want her off the ship!
Who?
Cookie! Our self-proclaimed gourmet chef.
What has she done?
She is serving dolphin down there, Capitano. Dolphin!
She is not.
She is! She told me and laughed. I should throw her into a torpedo tube and--

Fields.MenuText: Archimede, she's probably just getting back at you for insulting her soup.
Did you forget what you said about her soup? Maybe that's why she's giving you a hard time?
Don't serve criticism if you can't take the backlash, Archimede.

Fields.DialogueText: The soup was too salty. Was I supposed to lie?
Please, that is not an appropriate level of response.
I made a simple comment about the sodium levels of her dish.
I seem to remember you comparing it to sea water, before pouring it into the trash.
I didn't mean to... You're right, that was rude.
*ALARM*
I'll speak with her after.
Respectfully, Capitano, I'll take care of it.
Roger.
@BATTLE
We are approaching the edge of Sector 593.
*ALARM*
I doubt these Morganas are responsible for the disappearances, Capitano.
Agreed, there are too few.
@BATTLE
Capitano! Can you hear me? Don't move.

Fields.MenuText: I can, it's just a bump on the head. No, here comes the blood.
My head... it's throbbing... I need to get to medical.
My head hitting the console is echoing in my skull.

Fields.DialogueText: We need a medical team to the capitano!
It's a nasty gash, but it doesn't look fatal. Let's go.
Let's go. I'm helping you to medical, Capitano.
Thank you, Archimede. Continue our–
I'll keep us on mission, Capitano. Now stop talking.
You're getting a lot better at this. Me, not so much.
You're not supposed to look. How's the brain case?
Really good, actually. You're just painting like a machine over there.
You said you wanted to try something artistic.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't realize it would be this hard.
You make it look easy.
I think I'm starting to hate it.

Fields.DialogueText: You just need to wait for it to click. You know, Eureka!
Trust me, it's not. I am not completely satisfied with how this is turning out.
If you're angry at the paint, then paint angry. It is about expression.
Almost done. How is yours?
It's not ready.
The trick is to keep loose, relaxed, let the paint–
*ALARM*
Cattive Ragazze! I spilled all over. It's ruined!
Oh, look at that, so did I.
Nice try, Capitano, I already had a look. Ready?
Ready.
@BATTLE
ARCHIMEDE! I'm HuNgrY!
We are in range of the Morgana now.
Capitano, I don't believe it, but they are flying a white flag.

Fields.MenuText: They wish to PaRleY!? MoNsTeRs doN't geT tO pArley!
I like it. I wAnT iT on mY waLl!
Cowards! FiRe! fIrE! FIRE!

Fields.DialogueText: Engaging.
Yes, Capitano! Let me get it for you.
Yes, Capitano! FIRE!
@BATTLE
Captain, were you having another nightmare just now?
Yes... I was waiting for you. Just resting my eyes and–
We're on a dangerous mission, if I understand. You're having a normal response.
Not going to tell me what my dreams mean, Doc?
They mean you're stressed. Regardless, you're fit for duty. There is minor swelling in your brain, but if you keep taking your medication it will subside.
Thank you. Sorry for boring you with my nightmares.
No bore. Take care.
Capitano, why didn't you tell me about your nightmares?
Have you been eavesdropping, Archimede?
I was merely reviewing a new member of the medical staff. I couldn't help but overhear.

Fields.MenuText: Honestly, it's embarrassing. I haven't had nightmares like this since I was a kid.
I don't like hearing about other people's dreams. I was just extending the courtesy.
Archimede, I would appreciate if you would announce yourself when you're listening.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't be. I love a good nightmare, and they're usually the most interesting dreams.
Everyone isn't like you. Case in point, I'm very interested in dreams.
Sì, Capitano, of course.
If you want to hear about them, then I won't spare the details.
*ALARM*
Cattive Ragazze have been making regular passes, but they don't enter the sector.
Prepare to engage. We will discuss our next move after.
Yes, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Archimede, we need to talk about that toy you made.
Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes?
That would be the one.
Then I guess you're referencing certain superstitious crew members.

Fields.MenuText: Archimede, we are in an unpredictable location. It's normal for them to be on edge.
I'm not assigning any blame, but I do want the crew to be comfortable.
I told you before what I thought of that thing. They're not being unreasonable.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course its normal but that doesn't give them a right to project on Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes.
It sounds like you are assigning blame to Furball-bat-bird-porcelaineyes, Capitano.
Not unreasonable at all, Capitano. I love a good witch hunt. May I pick the next target of our fears and prejudice?
If I understand correctly, you played along when the senior crew were telling these stories to our new crew?
I might have alluded to the idea that it's powered by a Morgana heart. I told them all it was just a story. Later.
I've also ordered the senior crew to straighten out this out, but the fear stuck. I'm sorry.
Yes, Capitano. I'll dispose of it.
*ALARM*
Archimede, just keep Furball-bat-bird-porcelain-eyes in your quarters.
Yes, Capitano! Shall we?
Yes. Intercept the Morganas.
@BATTLE
Entering Sector 593, Capitano.
I want the entire ship on high alert. Don't travel too far in.
Coming to a full stop.

Fields.MenuText: Anything unusual out there?
Systems report.
Here we are.

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing, Capitano. Nothing at all.
All systems are fully functional, Capitano.
There is nothing to report, as of now.
We'll wait here. No reason to overextend.
I'm glad you're taking the cautious approach. I'd say overcautious–
cAutiOuss..
Excuse me?
We can't be overcautious in this situation.
*ALARM*
Morganas are holding outside of the sector.
Capitano, I suggest we engage them. If this is an ambush, they could be surrounding us.
Agreed.
@BATTLE
Bbbbbbb. Bbbbbb. RaaR! Stupid kazoo...
Archimede!
Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: Archimede, I think I broke my kazoo.
Archimede, what is wrong with this thing?
Your stupid summoning whistle broke.

Fields.DialogueText: Let me see. Easy fix, Capitano.
It looks like you broke the paper, Capitano. I'll fix it.
Capitano, it's broken because you broke it. Look.
Sorry, Archimede, I'm on edge.
No problem, Capitano. There, fixed.
That easy?
A simple yet elegant instrument. Have you been biting it?
Huh. I guess so.
Try to be easy on it, Capitano. Remember: hum, don't blow.
*ALARM*
waAaAaAeeEooOoo! WaAaEEeooOoOO!
Archimede, will you see to getting that alarm changed? I can't stand it.
I'll look into it.
@BATTLE
CaRefuL noW, iT coMes clOseR. It wiLl noT liKe cLosEr.
Just give me a glimpse and I'll blast you out of the water.
It TaUnts! HahAhajaJajA!
Quite!
Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: Archimede? Oh, I must have dozed off.
I fell asleep? I really need some rest.
Sorry, Archimede, I can't believe I fell asleep here.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, how is your head feeling?
Capitano, I can handle operations if you need a rest.
No need to apologize, Capitano, but I do insist you rest.
I feel fine, actually. Still, maybe I should go to sickbay. Sleeping on duty is unacceptable.
Capitano, you didn't look like you were sleeping.
*ALARM*
I'll deal with these Morganas and head straight to medical.
@BATTLE
Capitano, I need to speak with you about your injury.
wE're fRienDs yoU kNow?
Go on?
I'm concerned about your treatment. What exactly has Dr. Green done to help you? He hasn't kept any records.
GooOoOOoD friEndS.

Fields.MenuText: Honestly, I'm concerned too.
Dr. Green said I may get worse before I get better.
You're wrong!

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Capitano. What do I do?
Maybe Dr. Green isn't as knowledgeable as he lets on.
With all due respect, that response is unlike you, Capitano.
It's my fault, Capitano. I always meant to study medicine more, but I kept putting it off.
Archimede, you can't blame yourself for not knowing everything about everything.
No, but I can blame myself for not knowing how to help a friend, when that knowledge is sitting in some book.
*ALARM*
FinAlly!
Permission to acquire the medical related texts onboard, Capitano? After the engagement of course?
Granted, now let's have some fUn... yEsSssS...
@BATTLE
BrRrRrR! bRbRbRbRbR!
Yes, Capitano, what do you need?
Archimede, have you ever spoken with a Morgana?
I wouldn't classify it as a conversation but yes, I have heard them before. They're vulgar, crass, and uninteresting, truthfully.
Would it be possible for them to speak to humans? In the same way Belles hear them?
It would be unprecedented. I highly doubt it. Why?

Fields.MenuText: I think there is a Morgana speaking to me.
Maybe it's this place, Archimede. I hear something sometimes, a voice.
The Morgana are taunting me Archimede!

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, if that's true it could be very dangerous.
There is nothing supernatural about this place, I assure you. I also believe you.
I do believe you, but you're jumping to conclusions, Capitano.
tAttliN TattleTaLe.
What do I do, Archimede?
You inform me immediately if you even suspect you are losing your faculties. I'd also insist we reassign some of our seasoned crew to you, as assistants.
Thank you, Archimede. I agree.
*ALARM*
Capable, Capitano?
I wAnt rEd waVeS!
Very.
@BATTLE
Archimede, may I ask what you are doing to my desk?
Where are the reports, Dr. Green? I'm done waiting. I want to know how you are treating the capitano.
You're confused, Archimede. We resolved this.
I'm sorry? We resolved what exactly?
Your recent complaints have been resolved.
*ALARM*
Does that mean trouble?

Fields.MenuText: BrBrBrBrB! Archimede, report... Morgana, incoming.
Archimede! We hAve incoMing!
HaHahA! HuRry, ArChiMedE, tHey'Re wOn'T bE aNy lEft!

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Capitano! I'm on my way.
Sì, Capitano, en route.
Capitano? Yes, Capitano!
I'm coming back to speak with you... Later?
Later is fine, Archimede.
@BATTLE
All right.
Have something to say to me?
BraVe, isN't It?

Fields.MenuText: We're alone now. Where are you?
It's just you and me. Show yourself!
Stop hiding! It's one on one now.

Fields.DialogueText: aLonE. It doEsn'T kNoW iT's aLone.
YoU aNd mE? wHaT dO yOu mEan?
oNe onE One onE oNe.
We don't have a lot of time.
YeS, tHe wiNdoW, sEe Me?
There's nothing out there!
nOt ThrOugH. loOk cLoSe.
Hahaha! Yes! I see you, I sEe me! Hmmm? Ahhh, I see Morsels!
@BATTLE
Capitano, there are no more threats. Why didn't you sound the alarm?
WaNteD... I'm, I thought I could handle it?
Capitano, that's against article... I'll need to check, but you can't. I know you shouldn't do that.
You're right, Archimede. I don't know what came over me.
More! More! MOrE!
Capitano! Capitano, stand down!
Who? WHaT!?
@BATTLE
Capitano, look at me.
I see iT. LoUd aNd uGly, I see!
Don't think. Stop thinking. Look, trust me?

Fields.MenuText: That's easy. I trust you.
I? I trust... you.
Archimede? I'm sorry. What's happening?

Fields.DialogueText: Glad to hear it, Capitano. Now breathe.
Good. You're going to be fine, Capitano.
Try and relax, Capitano. Everything will be fine.
Archimede... what's happening?
It is a Morgana, Capitano. Somehow, it must be on the ship.
WhEre!? How can it be on the ship?
I don't know.
*ALARM*
HeRe tHeyArE, ArcHiMeDe.
Yes, Capitano, I have my notes. Can you keep it together?
YeS... Yes, Archimede, you know what to do.
@BATTLE
Next page. When most confused, you have found the source. Look around for Morgana. Hmmm. That's Dr. Green. No Morgana.
Next page. Smack them, then call security. Dr. Green?
Ow! Hey, Archimede?
Security to Dr. Green's quarters! Arrest Dr. Green.

Fields.MenuText: Dr. Green? Security, do as she says.
Are you sure? Security, follow her orders.
Security, lock him up, now!

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, yes, Dr. Green here.
It says right here: smack them, then call security.
That's right!
No? wHy? Me? I'vE noT...
So Dr. Green is in a special cell far from command because he's an antenna?
That's a fair analogy, Capitano. The Morgana, Confusion most likely, bounced off of him to get to us.
Especially when he was sleeping.
Indeed.

Fields.MenuText: So was Dr. Green brainwashed?
Dr. Green had no choice?
Poor Dr. Green.

Fields.DialogueText: Not at all, Capitano. He sought out Confusion.
The opposite, Capitano. He chose Confusion.
Save your sympathy, Capitano. He was working with Confusion.
How do you know that?
He won't stop talking about it. Goes on and on about the Morgana "truth" like someone's writing it down.
Moving on. You believe I hit a mine during one of our battles out here?
Yes. I was thinking more clearly and going over the battle records. Several munitions detonated on objects undetectable by radar.
How do mines leave no signs of debris? Could we disarm one?
I'm not sure, but I think I will have a theory. I drew several notes here that seemed like nonsense, but now they are very similar to a mine schematic.
You think you could see what Confusion was thinking?
I might have. I'll inform you as soon as I have this figured out.
*ALARM*
It seems the Morganas won't give us a moment's rest. Best we deal with them together.
@BATTLE
Capitano, we are ready to retrieve the mine from Sector 593.
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: I'd rather we not handle a mine while fighting Morganas.
Delayed again. Prepare for battle, Archimede.
Morganas. I can't decide if they have the best or worst timing.

Fields.DialogueText: That would be a challenge, but you're right. Safety first.
Yes, Capitano, battle ready.
That all depends on perspective, Capitano. Ready to engage.
@BATTLE
Easy on our heading, the mine is just ahead.
I see it.
You have control, Archimede. Let's get it.
On it, Capitano.
Well?
I'm aiming for quality, not speed, Capitano.
Of course. Inform me of any problems as they occur.
Disengaging... right over left... Eureka! We have it, Capitano!
Well done! Secure it and set a course out of here.
Right away.
Have you learned anything from the mine?
I'm dumbfounded, Capitano.
The mine is actually a high capacity ballast tank, much larger than any submarine's. It attaches itself to the hull of a ship and then sinks them.

Fields.MenuText: Hence no signs of destruction. Ingenious, but simple enough. So why are you dumbfounded?
What's confusing about that, Archimede?
Wait, I understand it, but you don't? Now I'm confused.

Fields.DialogueText: I've never seen Morganas be this inventive, Capitano.
That the Morgana created it. I've never known them to be creative.
How did the Morgana conceive it, Capitano? I never thought of them as inventors.
We shouldn't underestimate them.
Yes, Capitano.
Let's leave the sector, Archimede. We should deliver this mine to command.
*ALARM*
Morgana ships from the sector interior.
Bring us around, Archimede.
Yes, Capitano.
@BATTLE
Capitano, you finally come down to see me.
So it seems.
You've come for more of the truth?

Fields.MenuText: Save it, Green. I'm only here to officially strip you of your commission.
Dr. Green, you are officially stripped of your position. Enjoy your quarters.
You've made a big mistake, Dr. Green. Get used to your accommodations.

Fields.DialogueText: That will be all, guard. Grazie. Close the door.
Thank you, Dr. Green. I have begun revising my screening process. Guard? The door, please.
I did underestimate your job, Dr. Green, but you underestimated us. Guard, the door.
A Morgana sympathizer, Capitano. It's hard to believe.
It is. Command is going to have their hands full with this.
It does seem that he was working alone. How does someone lose themselves like that?
You mean like speaking with a Morgana and firing torpedoes wildly?
Capitano, I didn't mean...
I'm joking, Archimede. No reason for us to be uncomfortable about it. You saved me. It's a good story.
One I will tell again and again. Only to you, of course.
*ALARM*
If we fend off these Morganas quickly, I'll tell you that good dream I had.
Consider them dealt with!
